discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
You need to use noescape single quotes ...

Selected Answer: AC
A and C

questions.question_text: Which action may cause triggers to fire?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
It is NOT B - Updates to Feed Items — This action will not cause triggers to fire. Feed Item updates generally do not invoke triggers directly.

The answer is C - Cascading delete operations — This can indeed cause triggers to fire. Cascading deletes might affect related records, and if those records have triggers, those triggers will be executed.

choices.D: Changing a user's default division when the transfer division option is checked
choices.A: Renaming or replacing a picklist entry

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
IN CompanyName" does not exist. IN NAME FIELDS" is the answer, as described in the following reference
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.ja-jp.soql_sosl.meta/soql_sosl/sforce_api_calls_sosl_syntax.htm
Answer should be c right as search should be done in CompanyName field?

questions.question_text: What should a developer use to obtain the Id and Name of all the Leads, Accounts, and Contacts that have the company name "Universal Containers"?

choices.A: SELECT Lead.Id, Lead.Name, Account.Id, Account.Name, Contact.Id, Contact.Name FROM Lead, Account, Contact WHERE CompanyName = ‘Universal Containers’
choices.B: FIND ‘Universal Containers’ IN Name Fields RETURNING lead(id, name), account (id, name), contact(id, name)
choices.C: FIND ‘Universal Containers’ IN CompanyName Fields RETURNING lead(id, name), account (id, name), contact(id, name)
choices.D: SELECT lead(id, name), account (id, name), contact(id, name) FROM Lead, Account, Contact WHERE Name = ‘Universal Containers’

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers is building a recruiting app with an Applicant object that stores information about an individual person and a Job object that represents a job. Each applicant may apply for more than one job.

What should a developer implement to represent that an applicant has applied for a job?

choices.C: Master-detail field from Applicant to Job
choices.B: Junction object between Applicant and Job
choices.A: Lookup field from Applicant to Job
choices.D: Formula field on Applicant that references Job

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B should be correct

Selected Answer: B
It's B. C would mean that if one Jobs gets deleted, the Applicant record also get delete which is 100% incorrect in this case. Junction Object is always the best approach on these matters.
It's B. C would mean that if one Jobs gets deleted, the Applicant record also get delete which is 100% incorrect in this case.

To represent that an applicant has applied for a job in a many-to-many relationship (where each applicant can apply for multiple jobs, and each job can have multiple applicants), you should implement a Junction Object.
The question is ambiguous. It states that each applicant can apply for more than one job but does not explicitly state that each job can have more than one applicant... I would go with lookup here.

B. Junction object between Applicant and Job.

A junction object is the recommended approach to represent a many-to-many relationship between two objects in Salesforce. In this scenario, the Applicant object and the Job object have a many-to-many relationship, as one applicant can apply to many jobs and one job can receive applications from many applicants.
I dont think it is C because if the master is deleted then the child is also deleted. This is the case for an Applicant to many jobs

choices.D: Use Security.stripInaccessible to remove fields inaccessible to the current user.
choices.A: Use Lightning Data Service to get the collection of sales records.
choices.C: Use Lightning Locker Service to enforce sharing rules and field-level security.
choices.B: use WITH SECURITY_ENFORCED in the SOQL that fetches the data for the component.

questions.question_text:
A developer is creating a Lightning web component to show a list of sales records.

The Sales Representative user should be able to see the commission field on each record. The Sales Assistant user should be able to see all fields on the record except the commission field.

How should this be enforced so that the component works for both users without showing any errors?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
It coud be Lightning Data Service for one record, but it doesn`t work with list of records
